to Llandovery. Otherwise head west on the A40 from Abergavenny through Brecon to get there from the east
Llandovery is located on the famous Heart of Wales Line
at 4:36AM, 9:15AM, 1:17PM and 6:21PM, and depart Llandovery for Swansea at 7:48AM, 11:33AM, 4:32PM, 8:37PM. The journey takes around 1 hour 20 minutes.

The town is small enough to explore easily on foot.

value: content=The castle ruins are not substantial, but are worth a visit as they are conveniently located near the centre of the town.
Soak up the atmosphere of a small Welsh market town.
Attend a performance by the charity-run Llandovery Theatre
Llandovery serves as an excellent base for hiking in the
content=Is located in Stone Street. They sell a wide range of items including paints, tools, carpets, rugs, bedding and much more.
located in the old market hall in the center of town has a few shops specializing in good quality handicrafts from both Wales and places further afield, such as India and Nepal.
The cafe in the old market hall in the centre of town serves wholesome and delicious meals.

content=The Castle Hotel is run and owned by a group of restaurateurs rather than hoteliers so it's no surprise that food lies at the heart of the house – the family farm provides 90% of the natural tasting, free range meat and poultry used in the kitchens, supplemented by a loyal and brilliant network of hardworking and passionate local suppliers.
Good coffee and selection of teas at the cafe in the old market hall.

I have eaten at The Blue Bell on High Street and I thought it was fantastic! There was a lovely atmosphere and the food was incredible

value: content=Brecon Rd. Tel:+. A family run park in easy walking distance of Llandovery, excellent facilities, for independent reviews enter Erwlon camping reviews in Google. Rates: £4 - 14.50.
content=King's Street. Tel:+. A lovely old hotel located right in the heart of the town. Rates: £65+.
content=A six room hotel in mid-19th century grade II listed building
. Three  cottages with new interiors and views towards the Brecon Beacons. Ducks, dogs, geese and plenty of room to roam for the kids. From £395 p/w based on four sharing.

The following places are all within an hour's drive of the town:
